alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 4:17PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern El Dorado, northeastern Placer, east central Sierra and northeastern Nevada Counties through 500 PM PDT... At 417 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Alpine Meadows, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Soda Springs, Donner Peak, Soda Springs Ski Area, Sugarbowl Ski Resort, Kingvale and Meadow Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
